programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry discovers a mysterious locker with a strange hole in its wall, while Jarrod uses an old trick to put in a sneaky bid.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War era carbine shows up with a 'coffee grinder' in the shoulder stock, prompting the staff to try to assess the true value of the item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter from pioneer Ezra Meeker and a set of commemorative Oregon Trail coins are brought into the shop, along with a Gibson lap steel guitar.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Karen comes up with a big idea for the shop, while Byron puts two ice hockey fans in their place when they get physical over a vintage puck.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler make plans for Rick's stag night, and the team restores a three-wheeled all-terrain vehicle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a 1900s signal cannon and a folding bicycle before holding the shop's first auction.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: The case of an internet surfer known simply as David who became obsessed with website owner Joanna and murdered her partner Matthew Pyke in a jealous rage. With barely any details to properly identify or locate the man, police officers were faced with the task of tracking him down.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1988 case of a missing nine-year-old girl went cold, until an encounter at a bus stop breathed new life into the investigation and revealed the truth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary and Moe compete with a huge crowd of bidders, and the locker they are after is guaranteed to make Moe's wife angry.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Take a Deep Breath, It's Lesa
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Conroe, where they come face to face with an old adversary.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts open previously off-limits secret files in a bid to answer some of the most mysterious questions surrounding UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts open previously off-limits secret files in a bid to answer some of the most mysterious questions surrounding UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ultimate Vehicles
programme.desc: The milestones of engineering that have changed land, water, and air transport for good.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are intrigued by a mysterious locked trunk when they visit the former home of a circus, and a zebra-print motorcycle also catches their eye.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Ashley interferes with one of Karen's sales on the shop floor, a family feud breaks out. Meanwhile, a rock metal group drops by.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finally lands a buyer for his special edition Lee Iacocca Mustang, but loses his cool when he learns Seth sent the hot rod out on consignment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Following Joe's arrest, the employees express their displeasure when new security measures are implemented to make sure that no one steals anything.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee meets Marvel Comics creator Stan Lee to find out if a rare signed comic is the real thing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a Gilded Age train, before a classic Nintendo race car game from the 1960s rolls its way into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1974 Triumph Convertible, a pair of whale spears come into the shop, and Chum relives his childhood with a pair of Popeye water pistols.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey comes face to face with a Ronald Reagan foam head, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer on the piece.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick considers removing six Picasso etchings from an illustrated edition of Lysistrata, then he and Corey take an amphibious Jeep out on the water.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Lock Stock and Two Nickel Barrels
programme.desc: The pawn shop workers take a look at nickel-plated pistols, supposedly made by the most famous gun maker of the Victorian era.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Civil War era carbine shows up with a 'coffee grinder' in the shoulder stock, prompting the staff to try to assess the true value of the item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter from pioneer Ezra Meeker and a set of commemorative Oregon Trail coins are brought into the shop, along with a Gibson lap steel guitar.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is intrigued when a very valuable Pok√©mon collection makes its way into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a hat worn by Prince and a Second World War head-shaped grass planter is brought in.

programme.title: Mega Pit Stops
programme.desc: A look at how enormous vehicles, such as planes, trains and ships, are repaired and returned to service within incredibly short timeframe.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A ghost appears on the Gettysburg battlefield, a sea monster surfaces in Ireland and fleets of UFOs are spotted over the skies of Philadelphia and The Hague.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts examine the concept of crop circles, investigating whether these odd patterns could be a message from another world or just an elaborate hoax.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: It's a race against the clock as Marty, Rick and the team are blindsided by a shocking development that could spell the end of all Money Pit operations.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Dwayne and the crew head to a consistent urchin dive spot, where young dingy boy George endures a baptism of fire as everyone fights to bring in the most urchins.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Phil Kay, John Sessions and Clive Anderson for more interesting answers on subjects including bills, Bens and buildings in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Inbetweeners star Greg Davies, veteran stand-up Jo Caulfield and one-liner specialist Gary Delaney join host Dara O Briain and panellists Chris Addison, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons for another round of the satirical current affairs panel show. From September 2012.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Rich Hall, Josie Lawrence and John Sessions join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry, providing interesting answers to questions on butterflies, blackberries and Bernards.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Phil Kay, John Sessions and Clive Anderson for more interesting answers on subjects including bills, Bens and buildings in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Flack
programme.desc: While on a plane, Robyn has to summon up all her PR skills to make a demanding problem go away. The West Wing's Bradley Whitford guest stars.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Documentary following storm-chaser Josh Morgerman as he heads into the eye of some of the biggest and most dangerous storms around the world. In the first episode, he takes his documentary team into the fourth most powerful hurricane to hit mainland American since records began. Category 4 Hurricane Michael brings wind speeds of 155mph and unleashes more energy than an atomic bomb on Florida's Panama City.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain, and actor Michael Fassbender is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori find a hot-air balloon in their newly acquired trailer.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse lands some skydiving equipment, while Papa Bear struggles to fit into his latest purchase - a vintage sports car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The items Mike and Frank bought in Europe arrive in the US, and the guys also visit a vintage car company.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force. Rookie cop Ash is in the thick of it during a late night brawl in Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers of Staffordshire Police are presented with a challenging situation in Burton when a late night reveller decides to go for an impromptu swim in the River Trent.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Suspicions are raised when a routine x-ray reveals suspicious packages hidden inside the tyres of a pick-up truck. Officers also seize a large shipment of marijuana.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in their bid to build scrap cars. This time, they're up against pro driver Shane Lynch's Chevrolet Camaro in a plane-pulling contest. Building scrap able to get the 40-ton monster rolling will require innovation and a super-sized imagination..

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the light-hearted panel show, which sees comedy actress Miranda Hart, TV and radio host Reggie Yates and Countryfile presenter John Craven competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include stuffed marrows, spitting, the hip-hop handshake and Miranda's breasts.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees veteran broadcaster Terry Wogan, cricketer-turned-TV personality Phil Tufnell and writer, presenter and poker player Victoria Coren Mitchell compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include food packaging, health fads, the 1990s Australian cricket team, hors d'oeuvres and people who walk around changing rooms naked.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Greg Davies, presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle and journalist Janet Street-Porter to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include people who use suitcases on wheels, multichannel TV, umbrellas, friends' hobbies and women who like to be treated as ladies.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy determines that on no account will her plans for a surprise anniversary party for her parents be revealed. However, she then makes the big mistake of disclosing the details to Lee. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The friends' plans for a relaxing summer holiday don't get off to the best of starts when Lee gets a bad case of the jitters on the plane - and Lucy and Daisy have to endure the worst flight of their lives. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix, with Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee is worried that the woman of his dreams is drifting farther away - and admits his fears to Toby over a few drinks in the bar. Can his neighbour give him the advice he needs to win Lucy's heart once and for all? Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Hugh Dennis, with Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Maisie Adam, Sara Barron and Rob Beckett are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Room 101 host Frank Skinner presides over an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2018, with playwright Lucy Prebble and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The world's tallest roller coaster in Los Angeles' Six Flags Amusement Park, which was inspired by scenic railways and steam catapults on aircraft carriers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The story of royal doctor Bertrand Dawson, who admitted to performing euthanasia on a dying George V, and may have had a connection to a subsequent royal death.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The historical importance of freight trains, including four-mile long vehicles transporting enough iron ore to build two Eiffel towers.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the rise of train travel between cities led engineers to consider how to travel within them - leading to the development of the London Underground.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the Top of the Pops archives, featuring performances by acts including the Foundations, Procol Harum, the Bee Gees, the Rolling Stones, and Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A look at Edinburgh Castle - a symbol of Scottish might that has been besieged more than 20 times and has existed in many guises, including a military fortress, prison and palace.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor ends his journey by learning to drive a stunt car, sampling Hollywood luxury in an executive jet, cruising in a 1950s hot rod and taking an aerial tour.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Reid probe the apparently motiveless murder of a well-to-do businessman, focusing their investigations on a shady matrimonial agency with a roster of female clients from the former Soviet Union. Glasgow-set crime drama, starring Blythe Duff and James Macpherson.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor discovers a darker side to village life when there is a measles outbreak at the local school.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ramani and new DC Suzie Sim join forces in a bid to find out whether Terry's brother Ben has been abusing his son, while Honey attempts to deal with an emergency at St Hugh's hospital, only to find herself staring down the barrel of a gun. Back at the station, Jack resolves to give Jo Masters the benefit of the doubt - unlike Neil, who continues to seethe over her arrival.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: When the medieval monk investigates the murder of a wealthy cleric, the finger of suspicion immediately points to a new arrival at the abbey, but as Cadfael digs deeper, he uncovers connections to a family with tangled loyalties. Drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Terence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Ian McNeice, Christien Anholt and Julian Glover.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The corpse of a recently married man is found hidden in an antique suit of armour - much to Lovejoy's dismay. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A property developer approaches Lady Jane's husband and offers him a business partnership, making Lovejoy suspicious. Starring Ian McShane, with guest appearances by Nicky Henson and Sherrie Hewson.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads are forced to take a well-known British trouble-maker under their collective wing, but his presence in the hut soon leads to friction and a beating for Neville. Michael Elphick guest stars in the popular comedy drama.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz comes up with an unlikely get-rich-quick scheme - smuggling porn videos back to Blighty inside a dead expatriate's coffin. Unfortunately for him, an unforeseen stop-off at the crematorium ruins his plans. Jimmy Nail stars.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.sub-title: To Die or Not to Die
programme.desc: During a performance of Hamlet, young cast member Ben Faulkner collapses and dies. Initially the detectives think Ben died of natural causes, until Mike uncovers a complex web of ego-driven dissension among the troupe and follows his nose to the real cause of death.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: After a harsh anti-immigrant law comes into force, Murdoch and Brackenreid find themselves dealing with the fallout for its enforcers and the Greek immigrants it targets.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam suspects a riot is in the offing when a football fan is killed. Knowing the problem will escalate as time goes by, the detective becomes determined to nip the violence in the bud, so he, Gene and Annie go undercover in a pub to catch the culprits. However, he realises the derby match that will be the focus of the conflict is the last one he went to with his dad when he was four years old.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam hears his mother's voice saying goodbye, and worries that doctors in 2006 are about to turn off his life support system. When a hostage situation crops up, he becomes convinced that resolving the crisis without a single casualty will cause him to wake up in his own time. However, Gene is determined to go in with all guns blazing - putting everyone's safety at risk. John Simm stars.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform fairy-tale routines, hoping to get a high enough score from the judges and viewers to keep them out of the bottom two. Sadly there'll be no happy ever after for Radzi Chinyanganya, who lost the skate-off last week, but while the votes are being counted there will be a routine from Disney on Ice. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dino Dana, a spunky eight-year-old palaeontologist in training eats, sleeps and breathes dinos. Eager to attend Fossil Day at the Royal Ontario Museum, Dana asks her neighbour Mr Hendrickson to take her.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Lady Penelope and Parker are testing out FAB2, a luxury yacht, when they receive a distress call from a nearby tanker. A Tsunami has erupted, and a massive wave is headed for the stalled tanker's location.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom visits a haunted castle where a lovely gardener raises monster plants.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A scheming ghost inside a mirror trades places with Tom, and it's up to Jerry and Tuffy to stop him.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for billionaire Bruce Payne, aka the superhero, Ratman. When Ratman is kidnapped, Magoo decides to save the day..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is forced to baby-sit Mrs. Wicket's Nephew on an Outward Bound day course..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A raging forest fire will require the special skills of all five Tracy brothers to stop.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Cherry Healey from 10 Years Younger and chefs James Close, Maria Guseva, and Ryan and Liam Simpson-Trotman. Plus, Stefan Gates performs some explosive food experiments.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Volunteers test two more diets - Eat Yourself Healthy, the latest spin on gut health, and The Complete Pegan Diet for Beginners, a new catchphrase combining paleo and vegan approaches. How will they rank on the leaderboard? Ranj Singh looks at the return of fibre, finding out whether it is worth jumping on the bandwagon, and Sian Williams look at the latest veg boxes on the market which use mis-shapen produce before it ends up as waste.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Aviva Stadium. Both sides were victorious last weekend, with Wales easily defeating a poor Italian outfit, and Ireland somewhat fortunate to edge out Scotland on this ground. Ireland prevailed 37-27 when the sides last met here in this competition en route to the Grand Slam in 2018. However, the Welsh emulated that feat last year, securing the title with a 25-7 victory over today's opponents at Principality Stadium. Gareth Anscombe kicked 20 points on that occasion to ensure former head coach Warren Gatland ended the campaign as the only man to guide a nation to three Grand Slams. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Gareth Thomas and Jonny Wilkinson, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Shane Williams.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking former professional boxer Tony Bellew, singer and fashion designer Kelly Osbourne and BBC Breakfast presenter Dan Walker to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win ¬£50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the semi-final of the celebrity singing contest. Duck, Fox, Hedgehog, Octopus and Queen Bee are the five remaining singers and this week two more will be unmasked and eliminated, leaving only three to go through to next week's final. Ken Jeong returns to the panel, joining regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall in trying to guess the famous faces are behind the costumes.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,¬†Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor (1996)
programme.desc: An obese, terminally shy professor invents a potion that transforms him into a slim, loud-mouthed charmer. His new streamlined self immediately sets out to woo the woman of his dreams - but soon starts to ride roughshod over everything he used to care about. Remake of the 1963 Jerry Lewis comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett Smith, James Coburn and Larry Miller.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how a 1000-ton ship is lifted 70 metres into the air while it is still in water, and how criminals are prevented from cracking credit cards.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China restore a Jaguar XJC, an iconic 'corporate sports car' that is likely to attract plenty of admirers.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne flies out to Oregon and tries to fix up an untouched 1932 Stutz DV32, in the hope of selling it on for a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Four sisters seek car restorer Wayne Carini's advice about what to do with their father's 1939 BMW 328.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: One lucky fan's dreams come true as OCC head to Phoenix to surprise him and get inspiration for this chopper. S3/62/25 (HOH).

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.sub-title: 1964 Impala and 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air Wagon
programme.desc: The Impala is one step away from the junkyard, and a mistake in the shop takes the restoration of the Bel Air further than intended.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe experiences work in the steel industry when he visits a mill in St Louis.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Clay Liquor Jugs/Poultry Deli Meats/Nascar Engines
programme.desc: The manufacture of clay liquor jugs, poultry deli meats and Nascar engines.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of nail clippers, canola oil and poster restoration.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains must make hard choices as Typhoon Nuri closes in. The Northwestern charges into the storm, while the Cape Caution retreats to land.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design and production of the Chevy Camaro, which was introduced to the world in 1966, and has now reached its sixth generation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a TVR Cerbera for ¬£8,000, and Edd China works on restoring this classic sports car so it may be sold on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rust-free Triumph TR6 sports car from the 1970s that he wants to restore, but first mechanic Edd China has to rebuild the engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer returns to the UK to find a buyer for his Hindustan Ambassador. Plus, he gets a good deal on a Triumph Spitfire and Land Rover Defender, and hopes to make a profit.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A team of international investigators conducts a definitive inquiry into the possibility that Adolf Hitler may have survived the conclusion of the Second World War. Here the experts discover secret tunnels linking Hitler's bunker to Tempelhof Airport. After faking his own death, they wonder if the Nazi leader could have escaped by plane.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team finds proof of treasure in the jungle near a historic mission, and a spooky visit to an antique market uncovers Jesuit silver.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A cyclone threatens tanker driver Michael's delivery of hazardous chemicals to a desert mine site. Meanwhile, Tasmanian trucker Lindsay transports 80,000 angry bees to a rainforest.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy, Ant and Helen reimagine a modern Beetle with a '50s American Roadster look. Plus, Ant transforms a classic Royal Enfield motorcycle into a race bike.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Ian's fleet of ageing tractors buckle under the strain of the first harvest of the year. Ally faces spiralling costs as his new campsite venture slips months behind schedule.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard bargains hard in Frome, Somerset, then in Dumfriesshire visits an estate that has been in the same family for several generations and is full of fascinating antiques.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Nottingham Forest v Leeds United and Barnsley v Sheffield Wednesday.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: The twins ride the Redball Express, while Bruce Crompton blows up a van with Second World War rifle grenades and tracks down a 'Deuce-and-a-half' American army truck.

programme.title: My Dad's on Death Row
programme.desc: The case studies of John Battaglia and Coy Wesbrook, both featuring horrific murders, are outlined in detail with chilling interviews with the killers, along with heart-breaking and emotional interviews with their families.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How, in Moscow, a woman obsessed with the horror film Bride of Chucky went on a stabbing rampage with a gang of male accomplices, leading to the deaths of 15 people.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The New Year's Eve 2000 murders of Carl and JoAnna Dutcher and their 15-year-old grandson Tony, in the tiny Rocky Mountain outpost of Guffey. It transpired a school friend of Tony's, Scott Grimes, committed the act because he felt pressured by an older peer group with which he was associated.

programme.title: Aileen Wuornos: Monster
programme.desc: Aileen Wuornos murdered seven men in Florida between 1989 and 1990 by shooting them at point-blank range. She was America's first female serial killer. In this rare interview the woman, who was eventually executed by lethal injection, reveals intimate details of the love affair that led her to kill seven men.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: An insight into the anatomy of cats, discovering what helps them survive for weeks with no apparent supply of food or water.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa Chimes is under pressure to help a puppy that has been trampled on by its owner, while Dr Chris Brown travels to Adelaide to check on an extremely aggressive Peccary.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store's buyers head to Bridal Market Week, a crucial event where designers showcase their latest trends, while Sarah helps an Islamic bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Rasha needs a ball gown that will wow all 700 guests at her wedding, while Melissa's father has a surprise for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress for a traditional Greek wedding, while a customer hopes her gown will show off how much weight she has lost - but is upset by how she looks in it.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman with a childhood history of abuse followed in her mother's footsteps in overeating for protection, but is now trying to lose weight to save her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Bedridden for four years, Penny knows her weight may kill her unless drastic actions are taken, and hopes to have a gastric bypass before it is too late.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing over 700lbs at 26-years-old, the clock is ticking on Ashley's life. Ashamed of her body, surgery offers hope - but not without risks.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A blind customer argues with her mother, and a bride finds shopping with 13 bridesmaids an exhausting experience.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Good Things Come to Those Who Wait
programme.desc: A bride tries to gain her father's approval for her choice of gown, and a customer is under pressure to choose a dress months in advance of the big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer tells her family that she got engaged over the phone and has not seen her fiance in 12 years. Another bride goes shopping for a smaller gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer brings her fiance dress shopping against her mother's wishes, while another bride fears her weight loss will mean her dress needs altering.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: TV presenter Adrianna Costa visits the shop to find a dress for her wedding in the desert - but she and her mother have very different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Unsure of any of her wedding details, Whitney comes to the store looking for a dress with no style or budget in mind. Plus, a bride and her sister have difficulty agreeing on a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Meredith wants a simple dress for her laid-back wedding, but her family is unwilling to see her settle, and Lindsay is worried her dress won't fit her slimmed down figure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Lindsey could leave the store empty-handed when her big entourage forgets to consider her vision. After trying on more than 75 dresses, picky bride Monica has yet to find the one. Princess-obsessed Natalie surprises everyone at her dress fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: To Sleeve, or Not to Sleeve
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress that shows off her tattoos, but her mother does not approve. Another customer is given a veil as a family heirloom, and needs a gown that matches it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The rules of friendship are tested when best friend brides Jenaya and Terinni both fall in love with the same wedding dress. In for their fittings, brides Lex and Amy insist on keeping their final gown reveals a secret from each other until their big day.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa performs readings for celebrity clients, including Jim Parsons (The Big Bang Theory), Susan Lucci (Devious Maids) and Jamie-Lynn Sigler (The Sopranos).

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo is always nervous that she is going to get caught before a surprise. So, she decides to do the surprises in a series of disguises.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: The story of Jessica and her mother Dale, who have filled their home with junk, putting themselves in danger.

programme.title: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: A man whose murder by someone wearing a clown mask heralded similar attacks. Police soon realised that a particularly deranged serial killer was on the loose.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Shana Grice was murdered after being stalked by her ex-boyfriend, Michael Lane. He denied involvement, but experts examined police videos to determine the truth.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Part one of two. After NFL football player Aaron Hernandez's friend Odin Lloyd was found dead near his home, investigators turned their gaze on the sportsman.
